body.p: Sir, your petitioners Mark R. Boyd and Nathaniel Wilmot respectfully state to your Excellency that on the day of 18 one Reobert Altum of this county was arrested by Robert Capps Constable of Rockcastle County for an assault and, that they signed a bond for said Altums appearance before Milton Hurst a Justice of the peace and that on the day specified in said Bond, they appeared with said Altum at the office of said Hurst -- but the said Capps as Constable afsd Returned the case before one Tolbert Bowman a justice of the peace -- and in consequence of said Altum not appearing at the said Bowmans, the Bond was returned to the Circuit Court & forfeited and judgement rendered agst them for the sum of $100 -- & costs at the July ^Term afsaid court 1860^

Now they state that they have paid off the Commonwealths entire costs and there is nothing remains unpaid but the Commonwealths part of said fine -- which they ask
your Excellency to remit they state that they are poor men; and not able to pay the full amt, besides they think that they were unjustly dealt with by the Court -- from the fact that they took the man to the place stipulated in their bond -- Mt Vernon Ky July 1st 1861. ^The state that Execution is now in hands of the sheriff & their property levied upon wherefore they pray speedily relief^
Sworn to before m by M R Boyd this 1st July 1861
E. F. Fisk c R c c
We the undersigned believe the statements made in the foregoing petition are true & hope relief will be granted

W H Rictly
E T Fisk
J. G. Hazlewood
I think the fine ought to be remitted by all means

I heard the trial upon which the forgoing Judgment was rendered & honestly believe the Judgment was an error of the court & therefore & because of hard times & the petitioners being poore hope & believe that Your exelency will remit the fine

p.hi: E. F. Fisk. C. R. c. c

body.p:
Rockcastle Cir. ct
Remitted
$100 } Forfeited Recognizance
M. R. Boyd & Nathl Wilmot
Issd Jany 14 1861
